definition[0]: to pay someone more money than they deserve
example[0]: Most big companies continue to overpay their top executives.
definition[1]: to pay too much money for something
example[1]: Try to recover any tax you have overpaid.
definition[2]: to pay someone more than they deserve or are owed
example[2]: The effect of the tax change is that a lot of people will overpay and will then have to claim refunds.
example[3]: The Pentagon claims the two defense firms were overpaid by more than $1.3 billion over the years.
definition[3]: to pay too much for something in relation to its real value
example[4]: Did we overpay for the company? The price was probably on the high side.
